title: Cantele 2014 Teresamanara Negroamaro (Salento)
description: Dark cherry and blackberry aromas meld with tobacco leaf and eucalyptus on the nose. Round and juicy in feel, there's a nice expression of ripe dark fruit struck against a taut line of acidity and medium-grained tannins.

title: Casar de Burbia 2013 Hombros Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Aromas of raisin, prune, spice cake, clove and cinnamon are oaky. This selection of the high part of the grape bunch known as the shoulder feels grabby, with clamping tannins. Woodsy, earthy berry flavors are accompanied by licorice and clove notes, while chocolaty oak helps to overcome a light green character on the finish.

title: Cave de Turckheim 2016 Réserve Muscat (Alsace)
description: Fresh, ripe notes of Meyer lemon are joined by hints of rose. It is on the slender palate that the rose aromas become stronger, countered by lovely lemon freshness. The finish is dry, perfumed and refreshing.

title: Cave du Roi Dagobert 2016 Tradition Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: The nose is still under a cloud of reduction yet a vivid cherry aroma shines through. The palate offers the freshness of conifer, with fine tannins and a pleasant, youthful crunch. It is savorines that is in the foreground here, bewitching with spice and pervasive freshness. An easy, fresh but authentic Pinot.

title: Cecchi 2013  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano
description: Dark-skinned berry, forest floor, blue flower, toast and a whiff of culinary spice take the lead. The bright straightforward palate shows wild cherry, espresso and a hint of pipe tobacco framed in lithe tannins. Drink through 2021.

title: Charles & Charles 2016 Riesling (Washington)
description: Generous aromas of lime leaf, white peach, flower and slate lead to off-dry green-apple flavors backed by zippy acidity. The lovely sense of balance keeps you coming back for more.

title: Château Bibian 2015  Haut-Médoc
description: The vines of this 50-acre estate, close to Listrac, have produced a rich wine in this vintage. With its spice and toast character and ripe berry fruits coming together nicely, the wine will develop well. Its potential is for medium-term aging, meaning it will be ready to drink from 2023.

title: Château de Fonbel 2015  Saint-Émilion
description: This wine has tannins but its fruit speaks most clearly. It is crisp, fresh and perfumed with black-currant flavors from the Cabernet Sauvignon. The tannins will give this fruity wine time to age. Drink from 2019.

title: Bonfadini NV Brut Nature  (Franciacorta)
description: Subtle aromas of pressed chamomile, baked bread and dried yellow apple slice follow over to the palate along with white peach, toasted walnut and a hint of medicinal herb. Small persistent bubbles lend elegance while a citrus note refreshes the finish.

title: Bonfadini NV Opera Rosé  (Franciacorta)
description: Orchard fruit pressed wildflower aromas fill the glass along with a whiff of bread crust.The aromas follow over to the tangy palate along with dried herb and a hint of bitter walnut.

title: Château les Tresquots 2015  Médoc
description: This rich, black-currant and blackberry-flavored wine is perfumed, spicy and lightly smoky from wood aging. It is balanced between fruit and tannin, with a dry core that will allow it to age. It is a solid wine, ready to drink from 2023.

title: DeMorgenzon 2015 DMZ Syrah (Stellenbosch)
description: Bramble and spice characteristics grace the just-ripe plum and cherry fruit on the nose and mouth of this easy-drinking wine. It boasts a fine structure, with framing tannins and complex accents of fruit skin, smoked game and just a dash of peppery warmth on the close. Drink now–2020.

title: Descendant 2013 Mourvèdre (Red Mountain)
description: The aromas intrigue, with notes of dark raspberry, red and black licorice, herb and cherry gummy. Aged in neutral oak, it has a palate that emphasizes purity of expression. Put it on the dinner table to see it at its best. Drink now.

title: Château Haut-Piquat 2015  Lussac Saint-Émilion
description: Ripe Merlot makes its generous mark in this rich, fruity wine. It has structure and dense tannins as well as juicy black-currant fruits. The richness is not excessive, accompanying this core of tannins. Drink from 2023.

title: Château Martinet 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. This is ripe and smoky, full of black fruit notes as well as rich tannins. Spice and fine berry flavors will come together in this ripe, full-bodied and ageworthy wine. Drink from 2023.

title: Château Teyssier 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. The wine is ripe with juicy black currant fruit flavors and soft tannins. It is rich and fruit forward with tannins in the background, finishing smoky with bright acidity.

title: Château Valandraud 2017 Valandraud Blanc Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. Crisp fruit with a strong herbal edge gives this small production wine a lively, citrus character. Ample acidity lingers through a vibrant finish layered in notes of mineral and zest.

title: Château de la Brède 2017 Barrel Sample  (Graves)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. Fresh, fruity and laden with black currant notes, this wine is attractive already. Its spice and fine acidity give it an extra complexity that balances the fine fruitiness.

title: Château de Landiras 2017 Barrel Sample  (Graves)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. Ripe and juicy, this wine has generous tannins and attractive dense blackberry fruit flavors. It is a wine for drinking over the medium term with its easy, ripe fruitiness.

title: Château Valandraud 2017 Valandraud Blanc Barrel Sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. Crisp fruit and a strong herbal edge give this small-production wine a lively character. It has great acidity and a fresh, citrusy flavor as well as minerality on the zesty finish.

title: Château de Lamarque 2017 Barrel Sample  (Haut-Médoc)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. A fine, cassis-flavored wine with light, juicy fruit, this is immediately attractive. It has spice, ripe tannins and intense final acidity.

title: Château Ramage la Batisse 2017 Barrel Sample  (Haut-Médoc)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. This dense wine is rich in black fruits and layered with soft tannins. It has spice, a generous texture and final acidity. It should age relatively quickly, so drink from 2022.

title: Château Mouton Rothschild 2017 Le Petit Mouton de Mouton Rothschild Barrel Sample  (Pauillac)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. Dominated by Cabernet Sauvignon, this wine is full of delicious acidity and soft tannins. It is a lightly structured wine with prominent, juicy acidity and will age quickly.
designation: Le Petit Mouton de Mouton Rothschild Barrel Sample

title: Domaine Ostertag 2016 Les Jardins Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: An earthy touch hangs over pear and lemon aromas on the nose. The palate offers bright lemon freshness, with a slightly savory streak on the light, refreshing palate. Drink soon.

title: Domaine Rieflé-Landmann 2016 Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: Fleshy red cherry notes are expansive on the nose. These tones are equally expressive on the palate where they have a counterpoint of freshness. The body is textured with fine tannins, keeping the feel light and fluid. A lovely, easy and fruit-driven wine.

title: Dopff Au Moulin 2016 Maru White (Alsace)
description: Gentle notes of red apple appear on the nose. The palate has the same apple fruit that combines tart freshness with ripe fruit. This is easy and fresh, with a slight floral streak on its slender, dry body.

title: Duck Pond 2016 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: A fine value, this widely available Pinot doesn't shy away from its natural herbaceousness, but compensates with plenty of bright berry-cherry fruit. The compact tannins support a firm blackberry and black cherry core, and flavors persist on through a clean crisp finish.

title: Enrico Gatti NV Brut  (Franciacorta)
description: Spring blossom and white stone-fruit aromas lift out of the glass. On the lively palate, bright acidity raises yellow apple, citrus and a hazelnut note against a racy perlage.

title: Erath 2015 Willakia Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: This appears to be the top cuvée, at least by price, among the winery's 2015s. Cherry fruit comes through in a solid full-flavored core, leading into tannins that are still stiff and astringent. Give this extra breathing time, or a couple more years in the cellar.

title: Fattoria di Magliano 2013 Perenzo  (Maremma Toscana)
description: Made entirely with Syrah, this opens with aromas suggesting black-skinned berry, underbrush and cooking spice. The firm palate offers blackberry, licorice and bay leaf alongside close-grained tannins.
